Key Match Events: LaMelo Ball had 32 points and 10 rebounds, leading the Charlotte Hornets to a 115-104 win over the Phoenix Suns.
Miles Bridges added 21 points for the Hornets.
Nick Richards contributed 15 points and 12 rebounds off the bench for Charlotte.
Devin Booker scored 39 points and had 10 assists for the Suns.
Kevin Durant added 26 points for the Suns.
The Hornets took a 13-point lead at the half after outscoring the Suns 37-17 in the second quarter.
LaMelo Ball scored 29 points in the second half on 8-of-15 shooting, including four 3-pointers.
Charlotte dominated Phoenix on the glass, outrebounding the Suns 59-42.
Leading by eight, Ball drew in two defenders and dished to an open Brandon Miller, who knocked down a wide-open 3-pointer from the corner to put the Hornets up by 11 with 1:21 left in the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was only the third game this season — and first time for back-to-back games — the Hornets have had all five starters on the floor together.
The Hornets' starting five finally seemed to gel late in the second quarter when there was good ball movement that created open shots.
Phoenix started strong but seemed to tire quickly playing on the second night of a back-to-back and couldn’t find any scoring options outside of Durant and Booker.
Bradley Beal was limited to 10 points on 5-of-13 shooting and missed an open layup at the end of the first quarter.
Others: Both teams are in action Thursday night with the Suns hosting the Hawks, and the Hornets visiting the Lakers.
